One more of those inconvenient details associated with the real 
world, is =
that when you spend someone else's time/money, there are 
restrictions on w=
here you put your words. The label of company 
proprietary is often applied=
 with a broad roller paint brush.

So, breadcrumbs are as good as it gets t=
his time around. Prior posts 
and cited references are more than sufficient=
 for the ready, willing 
and able investigator. Otherwise, as stated so suc=
cinctly by Dr. John 
Burkardt, "I will not do your damn homework."
( http:/=
/orion.math.iastate.edu/burkardt/f_src/f_src.html )
